speaker: Emma
text: Noah, I noticed you missing some important comments in your last review. We need to aim for consistency across the team.
ipa: ˈnoʊə | aɪ ˈnoʊtɪst jə ˈmɪsɪŋ səm ɪmˈpɔɹtənt ˈkɑmənts ɪn jɚ læst ɹɪˈvju | wi nid tə eɪm fɚ kənˈsɪstənsi əˈkɹɔs ðə tim
stress: Noah | I NOTICED you MISSING some IMPORTANT COMMENTS in your LAST REVIEW | we NEED to AIM for CONSISTENCY across the TEAM
linking:
"noticed you" → /ˈnoʊtɪst jə/ (t + y linking)
"need to" → /nid tə/ (to reduced)

speaker: Noah
text: You're right. I intend to pay more attention to code standards from now on. I can't help feeling a bit nervous when reviewing senior devs' code, though.
ipa: jɚ raɪt | aɪ ɪnˈtɛnd tə peɪ mɔɹ əˈtɛnʃən tə koʊd ˈstændɚdz frəm naʊ ɑn | aɪ kænt hɛlp ˈfilɪŋ ə bɪt ˈnɝvəs wɛn ɹɪˈvjuɪŋ ˈsinjɚ dɛvz koʊd ðoʊ
stress: You're RIGHT | I INTEND to PAY more ATTENTION to CODE STANDARDS from NOW ON | I CAN'T HELP FEELING a BIT NERVOUS when REVIEWING SENIOR DEVS' CODE, though
linking:
"intend to" → /ɪnˈtɛnd tə/ (to reduced)
"code standards" → /koʊd ˈstændɚdz/ (d + s)

speaker: Emma
text: I get that. But remember, you are allowed to point out anything that could improve the project, no matter who wrote it.
ipa: aɪ ɡɛt ðæt | bət ɹɪˈmɛmbɚ | jʊ ɑɹ əˈlaʊd tə pɔɪnt aʊt ˈɛniˌθɪŋ ðət kəd ɪmˈpɹuv ðə ˈpɹɑʤɛkt | noʊ ˈmætɚ hu ɹoʊt ɪt
stress: I GET that | but REMEMBER | you are ALLOWED to POINT OUT ANYTHING that could IMPROVE the PROJECT | no matter WHO WROTE it
linking:
"allowed to" → /əˈlaʊd tə/ (to reduced)
"point out" → /pɔɪnt aʊt/ (t + o)

speaker: Noah
text: Thanks, Emma. I decided to start writing notes during my reviews to organize my thoughts.
ipa: θæŋks ˈɛmə | aɪ dɪˈsaɪdɪd tə stɑɹt ˈɹaɪtɪŋ noʊts ˈdɝɪŋ maɪ ɹɪˈvjuz tə ˈɔɹɡəˌnaɪz maɪ θɔts
stress: Thanks, Emma | I DECIDED to START WRITING NOTES during my REVIEWS to ORGANIZE my THOUGHTS
linking:
"decided to" → /dɪˈsaɪdɪd tə/ (to reduced)
"writing notes" → /ˈɹaɪtɪŋ noʊts/ (ng to vowel)

speaker: Emma
text: That’s a great idea! Also, I recommend focusing on one thing at a time — like readability first, then performance.
ipa: ðæts ə ɡɹeɪt aɪˈdiə | ˈɔlsoʊ | aɪ ˌrɛkəˈmɛnd ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ ɑn wʌn θɪŋ ət ə taɪm | laɪk ˌɹidəˈbɪləti fɝst | ðɛn pɚˈfɔɹməns
stress: That’s a GREAT idea | Also | I RECOMMEND FOCUSING on ONE THING at a TIME — like READABILITY FIRST, then PERFORMANCE
linking:
"recommend focusing" → /ˌrɛkəˈmɛnd ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ/ (smooth link)
"thing at a time" → /θɪŋ ət ə taɪm/ (t links)

speaker: Noah
text: Got it. I hope to get faster at it too, because sometimes I end up spending hours on a single pull request.
ipa: ɡɑt ɪt | aɪ hoʊp tə ɡɛt ˈfæstɚ ət ɪt tu | bɪˈkəz ˈsəmˌtaɪmz aɪ ɛnd ʌp ˈspɛndɪŋ ˈaʊɚz ɑn ə ˈsɪŋɡəl pʊl ɹɪˈkwɛst
stress: Got it | I HOPE to GET FASTER at it too | because SOMETIMES I END UP SPENDING HOURS on a SINGLE PULL REQUEST
linking:
"hope to" → /hoʊp tə/ (to reduced)
"end up" → /ɛnd ʌp/ (d + u)

speaker: Emma
text: Totally normal at the beginning. You must remember to check the guidelines document we shared last week.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli ˈnɔɹməl ət ðə bɪˈɡɪnɪŋ | jʊ mʌst ɹɪˈmɛmbɚ tə ʧɛk ðə ˈɡaɪdlaɪnz ˈdɑkjumənt wi ʃɛɹd læst wik
stress: Totally NORMAL at the BEGINNING | you MUST REMEMBER to CHECK the GUIDELINES DOCUMENT we SHARED last WEEK
linking:
"remember to" → /ɹɪˈmɛmbɚ tə/ (to reduced)
"shared last" → /ʃɛɹd læst/ (d to l)

speaker: Noah
text: Will do. And I don't mind reviewing extra PRs this week to get more practice.
ipa: wɪl du | ənd aɪ doʊnt maɪnd ɹɪˈvjuɪŋ ˈɛkstɹə pi ɑɹz ðɪs wik tə ɡɛt mɔɹ ˈpɹæktɪs
stress: Will do | and I DON'T MIND REVIEWING EXTRA PRs this WEEK to GET MORE PRACTICE

speaker: Emma
text: Awesome! Just avoid rushing through them — it could lead to missing critical bugs.
ipa: ˈɑsəm | ʤəst əˈvɔɪd ˈɹʌʃɪŋ θɹu ðɛm | ɪt kəd lid tə ˈmɪsɪŋ ˈkɹɪtɪkəl bʌɡz
stress: Awesome | just AVOID RUSHING THROUGH them — it could LEAD to MISSING CRITICAL BUGS

speaker: Noah
text: Understood. I'll continue taking my time but try to be more efficient.
ipa: ˌʌndɚˈstʊd | aɪl kənˈtɪnju ˈteɪkɪŋ maɪ taɪm | bət tɹaɪ tə bi mɔɹ əˈfɪʃənt
stress: Understood | I'll CONTINUE TAKING my TIME but TRY to be MORE EFFICIENT
